83LevelSet::LevelSet(LevelSetFillIn expectedFillIn) {
84
85 m_expectedFillIn = expectedFillIn ;
86
87 m_objects.clear() ;
88
89 m_signedDistance = true ;
90
91 m_forceSignPropagation = false;
92 m_signPropagationEnabled = false;
93
94 m_narrowBandSize = 0;
95
96}
97
101void LevelSet::clear(){
102 removeObjects();
103 m_kernel.reset();
104}
105
113void LevelSet::update( const std::vector<adaption::Info> &adaptionData ){
114
115 assert(m_kernel && "LevelSet::setMesh() must be called prior to LevelSet::update()");
116
117 // Update kernel
118 bool updated = m_kernel->update( adaptionData ) ;
119 if (!updated) {
120 return;
121 }
122
123 // Update objects
124 for( int id : m_orderedObjectsIds){
125 LevelSetObject *object = m_objects.at(id).get() ;
126 object->update( adaptionData ) ;
127 }
128}
129
145double LevelSet::getNarrowBandSize() const {
146 return m_narrowBandSize;
147}
148
164void LevelSet::setNarrowBandSize(double size) {
165 // Set narrow band size
166 m_narrowBandSize = std::max(size, 0.);
167
168 // Set object narrow band size
169 for (auto &objectEntry : m_objects) {
170 LevelSetObject *object = objectEntry.second.get();
171 object->setNarrowBandSize(size);
172 }
173}
174
183void LevelSet::setMesh( VolumeKernel* mesh ) {
184
185 // Mesh can be set only once
186 if (m_kernel) {
187 throw std::runtime_error ("Mesh can be set just once.");
188 }
189
190 // Create the kernel
191 if (VolCartesian *cartesian = dynamic_cast<VolCartesian *>(mesh)) {
192 m_kernel = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetKernel>(new LevelSetCartesianKernel(*cartesian, m_expectedFillIn));
193 } else if (VolOctree *octree = dynamic_cast<VolOctree *>(mesh)) {
194 m_kernel = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetKernel>(new LevelSetOctreeKernel(*octree, m_expectedFillIn));
195 } else if (VolUnstructured *unstructured = dynamic_cast<VolUnstructured*>(mesh)) {
196 m_kernel = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetKernel>(new LevelSetUnstructuredKernel(*unstructured, m_expectedFillIn));
197 } else {
198 throw std::runtime_error ("Unable to create the levelset kernel. Mesh type non supported.");
199 }
200
201 // Assign the kernel to the existing objects
202 for( int id : m_orderedObjectsIds){
203 LevelSetObject *object = m_objects.at(id).get() ;
204 object->setKernel(m_kernel.get());
205 }
206
207}
208
217int LevelSet::addObject( std::unique_ptr<SurfUnstructured> &&segmentation, double angle, int id ) {
218
219 auto object = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject>(new LevelSetSegmentationObject(id, std::move(segmentation), angle));
220
221 return registerObject(std::move(object));
222}
223
232int LevelSet::addObject( SurfUnstructured *segmentation, double angle, int id ) {
233
234 auto object = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject>(new LevelSetSegmentationObject(id, segmentation, angle));
235
236 return registerObject(std::move(object));
237}
238
247int LevelSet::addObject( std::unique_ptr<SurfaceKernel> &&segmentation, double angle, int id ) {
248
249 auto surfUnstructured = std::unique_ptr<SurfUnstructured>(dynamic_cast<SurfUnstructured *>(segmentation.release())) ;
250 if (!surfUnstructured) {
251 throw std::runtime_error ("Segmentation type not supported");
252 }
253
254 auto object = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject>(new LevelSetSegmentationObject(id, std::move(surfUnstructured), angle));
255
256 return registerObject(std::move(object));
257}
258
267int LevelSet::addObject( SurfaceKernel *segmentation, double angle, int id ) {
268
269 SurfUnstructured *surfUnstructured = dynamic_cast<SurfUnstructured *>(segmentation);
270 if (!surfUnstructured) {
271 throw std::runtime_error ("Segmentation type not supported");
272 }
273
274 auto object = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject>(new LevelSetSegmentationObject(id, surfUnstructured, angle));
275
276 return registerObject(std::move(object));
277}
278
286int LevelSet::addObject( const std::unordered_set<long> &list, int id ) {
287
288 assert(m_kernel && " levelset: setMesh must be called before adding a mask object ");
289
290 auto object = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject>(new LevelSetMaskObject(id, list, *m_kernel->getMesh()));
291
292 return registerObject(std::move(object));
293}
294
304int LevelSet::addObject( const std::vector<long> &list, long refInterface, bool invert, int id ) {
305
306 assert(m_kernel && " levelset: setMesh must be called before adding a mask object ");
307
308 auto object = std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject>(new LevelSetMaskObject(id, list, refInterface, invert, *m_kernel->getMesh()));
309
310 return registerObject(std::move(object));
311};
312
319int LevelSet::addObject( std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject> &&object ) {
320
321 return registerObject(std::move(object));
322};
323
329int LevelSet::registerObject( std::unique_ptr<LevelSetObject> &&object ) {
330
331 // Set object id
332 int id = object->getId();
333 if (id == levelSetDefaults::OBJECT) {
334 id = m_objectIdentifierGenerator.generate();
335 object->setId(id);
336 } else {
337 m_objectIdentifierGenerator.setAssigned(id);
338 }
339
340 // Set object properties
341 object->setDefaultLevelSetSigndness(m_signedDistance);
342 object->setNarrowBandSize(m_narrowBandSize);
343 if (m_forceSignPropagation) {
344 if (m_signPropagationEnabled) {
345 object->setCellBulkEvaluationMode(LevelSetBulkEvaluationMode::SIGN_PROPAGATION);
346 } else {
347 object->setCellBulkEvaluationMode(LevelSetBulkEvaluationMode::NONE);
348 }
349 }
350
351 // Set object kernel
352 if (m_kernel) {
353 object->setKernel(m_kernel.get());
354 }
355
356 // Add the object to the levelset
357 m_objects[id] = std::move(object) ;
358 registerObjectId(id);
359 incrementObjectsReferenceCount(id);
360
361 return id;
362}
363
367void LevelSet::removeObjects() {
368 m_orderedObjectsIds.clear();
369 m_objectIdentifierGenerator.reset();
370 m_objects.clear();
371}
372
379bool LevelSet::removeObject(int id) {
380 return unregisterObject(id, false);
381
382}
383
393bool LevelSet::unregisterObject(int id, bool force) {
394 if( !force && !isObjectRemovable(id) ) {
395 return false;
396 }
397
398 decrementObjectsReferenceCount(id);
399 unregisterObjectId(id);
400 m_objectIdentifierGenerator.trash(id);
401 m_objects.erase(id);
402
403 return true;
404
405}
406
414bool LevelSet::isObjectRemovable(int id) {
415 auto objectItr = m_objects.find(id) ;
416 if( objectItr == m_objects.end() ){
417 return false;
418 }
419
420 const LevelSetObject *object = objectItr->second.get() ;
421 if( object->getReferenceCount() > 0 ) {
422 return false;
423 }
424
425 return true;
426
427}
428
441void LevelSet::registerObjectId( int id ) {
442
443 // Add the id from the list
444 //
445 // Ids should be sorted according to the order in which they corresponding objects should be
446 // processed: first the ids of the primary objects (in the order the objects were added to
447 // the levelset) and then the ids of the other objects (in the order the objects were added
448 // to the levelset).
449 std::vector<int>::iterator idItr;
450 if(getObjectPtr(id)->isPrimary()){
451 std::vector<int>::iterator orderedIdsBegin = m_orderedObjectsIds.begin();
452 std::vector<int>::iterator orderedIdsEnd = m_orderedObjectsIds.end();
453
454 for (idItr = orderedIdsBegin; idItr != orderedIdsEnd; ++idItr) {
455 int candidateId = *idItr ;
456 const LevelSetObject *candidateObject = getObjectPtr(candidateId) ;
457 if( !candidateObject->isPrimary() ){
458 break;
459 }
460 }
461 } else {
462 idItr = m_orderedObjectsIds.end();
463 }
464
465 m_orderedObjectsIds.insert(idItr, id) ;
466
467}
468
476void LevelSet::unregisterObjectId(int id){
477
478 // Remove the id from the list
479 std::vector<int>::iterator orderedIdsBegin = m_orderedObjectsIds.begin();
480 std::vector<int>::iterator orderedIdsEnd = m_orderedObjectsIds.end();
481
482 std::vector<int>::iterator idItr = std::find(orderedIdsBegin, orderedIdsEnd, id);
483 assert(idItr != orderedIdsEnd);
484 m_orderedObjectsIds.erase(idItr);
485
486}
487
492void LevelSet::incrementObjectsReferenceCount(int parentId) {
493
494 const LevelSetObject *parentObject = getObjectPtr(parentId);
495 if( parentObject->isPrimary() ){
496 return;
497 }
498
499 if( const LevelSetProxyBaseObject *parentProxyObject = dynamic_cast<const LevelSetProxyBaseObject *>(parentObject) ){
500 for ( int sourceObjectId : parentProxyObject->getSourceObjectIds() ){
501 getObjectPtr(sourceObjectId)->incrementReferenceCount();
502 }
503 }
504
505}
506
511void LevelSet::decrementObjectsReferenceCount(int parentId) {
512
513 const LevelSetObject *parentObject = getObjectPtr(parentId);
514 if( parentObject->isPrimary() ){
515 return;
516 }
517
518 if( const LevelSetProxyBaseObject *parentProxyObject = dynamic_cast<const LevelSetProxyBaseObject *>(parentObject) ){
519 for ( int sourceObjectId : parentProxyObject->getSourceObjectIds() ){
520 getObjectPtr(sourceObjectId)->decrementReferenceCount();
521 }
522 }
523
524}
525
532LevelSetObject & LevelSet::getObject( int id) const{
533 return getObject<LevelSetObject>(id);
534}
535
541LevelSetObject * LevelSet::getObjectPtr( int id) const{
542 return getObjectPtr<LevelSetObject>(id);
543}
544
549std::vector<LevelSetObject *> LevelSet::getObjectPtrs( ) const{
550 return getObjectPtrs<LevelSetObject>();
551}
552
557int LevelSet::getObjectCount( ) const{
558 return m_objects.size() ;
559}
560
565std::vector<int> LevelSet::getObjectIds( ) const{
566 std::vector<int> ids ;
567 ids.reserve(m_objects.size()) ;
568 for(const auto &entry : m_objects) {
569 ids.push_back(entry.first) ;
570 }
571
572 return ids ;
573}
574
579void LevelSet::dump( std::ostream &stream ) const{
580
581 utils::binary::write(stream, m_expectedFillIn);
582 utils::binary::write(stream, m_signedDistance);
583 utils::binary::write(stream, m_forceSignPropagation);
584 utils::binary::write(stream, m_signPropagationEnabled);
585 utils::binary::write(stream, m_narrowBandSize);
586
587 m_objectIdentifierGenerator.dump(stream);
588 for( const auto &object : m_objects ){
589 object.second->dump( stream ) ;
590 }
591 utils::binary::write(stream, m_orderedObjectsIds);
592
593}
594
599void LevelSet::restore( std::istream &stream ){
600
601 utils::binary::read(stream, m_expectedFillIn);
602 utils::binary::read(stream, m_signedDistance);
603 utils::binary::read(stream, m_forceSignPropagation);
604 utils::binary::read(stream, m_signPropagationEnabled);
605 utils::binary::read(stream, m_narrowBandSize);
606
607 m_objectIdentifierGenerator.restore(stream);
608 for( const auto &object : m_objects ){
609 object.second->restore( stream ) ;
610 }
611 utils::binary::read(stream, m_orderedObjectsIds);
612
613}
614
619void LevelSet::setSign(bool flag){
620 m_signedDistance = flag;
621
622}
623
636void LevelSet::setPropagateSign(bool flag){
637 // Set propagation
638 m_forceSignPropagation = true;
639 m_signPropagationEnabled = flag;
640
641 // Set object bulk evaluation mode
642 for (auto &objectEntry : m_objects) {
643 LevelSetObject *object = objectEntry.second.get();
644 if (m_forceSignPropagation) {
645 if (m_signPropagationEnabled) {
646 object->setCellBulkEvaluationMode(LevelSetBulkEvaluationMode::SIGN_PROPAGATION);
647 } else {
648 object->setCellBulkEvaluationMode(LevelSetBulkEvaluationMode::NONE);
649 }
650 }
651 }
652}

743void LevelSet::update( const std::vector<adaption::Info> &adaptionData, int id){
744
745 BITPIT_UNUSED(id);
746
747 log::warning() << " It is not possible to update the levelset for a specific objects." << std::endl;
748 log::warning() << " Levelset will be computed for all the objects." << std::endl;
749
750 update(adaptionData);
751
752}
753
764void LevelSet::update( const std::vector<adaption::Info> &adaptionData, const std::vector<int> &ids ){
765
766 BITPIT_UNUSED(ids);
767
768 log::warning() << " It is not possible to update the levelset for a specific objects." << std::endl;
769 log::warning() << " Levelset will be computed for all the objects." << std::endl;
770
771 update(adaptionData);
772
773}
